quote: Captain's log, stardate 44995.3.   We are en route to the Klingon   Home World, where I will   participate in the installation   ceremony of Gowron, the next   designated Leader of the High   Council.
This visit should also provide   an opportunity for one of my   officers to correct... a grave   injustice..
Enter.
Am I intruding?
No, sir. My apologies, Captain...   I can be back in uniform---
That won't be necessary.       I'm not here as your captain.   I'm here as the person that stood   with you before the High   Council... your cha'DIch.
We'll arrive at your Home World   in less than a day.
It is not yet time.
That doesn't sound like the man   who came to me a year ago...   fiercely determined to return home   and clear his father's name...   or die trying.

You accepted this... dishonor from   the Council in order to hold the   Empire together.       The Empire survives. Isn't it   time to confront the Council...   to regain your family name and   let the truth be known?
I have been told... that patience   is sometimes a more effective   weapon than a sword.
Patience is a... human virtue,   one which I am proud to see you've   taken to heart. But this   situation may require a more...   Klingon response.
Your discommendation is a facade   intended to protect men less   honorable than you. It is a   lie... and lies must be   challenged.
I have grown... weary of bearing   this dishonor...
We will be in orbit around your   planet for at least two days...   it may be some time before we   return again. I would be   favorably disposed to grant a   leave should you request one.
Bridge to Captain Picard.
Thank you, sir.
Go ahead, Number One.
We've been intercepted by the   Klingon vessel Bortas. They claim   to be our escort.
No escort was scheduled.
The Bortas is standing by,   Captain.
On screen.
Gowron... this is an unexpected   pleasure.
I must speak with you, Picard.   We have to move quickly if we are   to be successful.
Successful?
Yes.       In preventing a Klingon civil war.
The family of Duras is massing   support... they have many allies   on the Council...
But Duras died in disgrace. By   Klingon tradition, his family   should share in that disgrace.
Their corruption has poisoned the   Empire. Honor will soon have   no meaning.
Who speaks for his family now?
Lursa and B'Etor... the sisters   of Duras.
And they would claim leadership   of the Council?
Women may not serve on the   Council...
Then how... ?

I don't know. But they are   plotting something. They have   secured the loyalty of at least   three fleet commanders.       Their followers do not care about   Duras' crimes. Lursa and B'etor   are feared... and fear is power.
I fail to see what I can do to   assist...
You were first chosen as arbiter   of succession because no Klingon   could be trusted. You accepted   this duty... and you must see it   through to the end. You must   ensure my installation.
I am prepared to report to the   Council that only you have   completed the rite of   succession...
Not enough. Duras was a Romulan   collaborator. You must declare   his family ineligible to ever   again sit on the ruling Council.
That... is beyond my purview.
You will not support me?
I will not step outside the   traditional role of the arbiter.
And if they attempt to block my   installation?
I can only assure you that I will   deal with any challenge according   to Klingon law.
I fear that will not be enough.
Mister Worf, please escort our   guest to the transporter room.
Mister Data, begin monitoring   Romulan activity along the Neutral   Zone. Have the outpost stations   there start sending us their   tactical reports.
Yes, sir.
The Duras family is preparing to   move against Gowron.
Backed by Romulans?
I don't know. But there's too   much history between the Duras    and the Romulans   to discount the possibility.
Dismissed.
I would speak with you.
I do not hear the words of a   traitor.
I am not a traitor.
You admitted your guilt before   the Council.
I accepted discommendation to   protect the Empire.
Protect it? How?
It was Duras' father who betrayed   our people to the Romulans at   Khitomer. Not mine.
Duras. There is proof of this?
There is.
Why would you accept dishonor   to protect Duras?
His family was too powerful. To   expose him would have split the   Empire. Instead, the Council   chose to blame my father.
The Council knew?
I believe you are a man of honor,   Gowron.       I ask you to restore my family   name.
Worf, you killed Duras. I   consider that no small favor.   But what you ask is impossible.
But after your Installation...
The grasp of Duras reaches out   from the grave. Much of the   Council is still loyal to his   family. I must have the   Council's support to survive.   I cannot expose their treachery.
You chose to accept this disgrace   for the good of the Empire. Now,   you must live with your decision   like a Klingon.
Guinan?
Hi. Ten Forward's been pretty   quiet today... I thought I'd get   in a little target practice. Mind   if I join you?
You... practice?
Sure. I like to keep my eye   sharp.
I... practice at... level   fourteen.
That's okay. I can go back to   that level for a while.
You know, I have a bet with the   captain that I can make you smile   before you make lieutenant   commander.
Not a good bet today.
Ready?       Computer, level fourteen... begin   program.
Program initiated.
I'm sure I heard you laugh   once... I liked it...
Klingons don't laugh.
Not true. Not true at all. You   may not laugh. But believe me,   I've heard some Klingon belly   laughs that could shake a room.
Your son laughs and he's Klingon.
He's a child. And part human.
Oh, that's right and you're not.   You're all Klingon. Except you   don't laugh.
I don't laugh because I don't feel   like laughing.
But other Klingons feel like   laughing. What does that say   about you... ?
(gritting his teeth,     frustrated)   Perhaps it says... I do not feel   like other Klingons.
Program complete.
Good game.    (off his unhappy     expression)   Hey, don't feel bad... I was   doing this years before you were   born.
How is he, by the way? Your son.
He is having some... difficulties   adjusting to life on Earth.
Must be tough for a little guy   like that... living with humans,   being Klingon... it has to get   confusing sometimes...
It will not be easy for him...
No, it won't. But the time will   come when he'll have to find out   what it really means to be   Klingon...       Just as the time has come now for   you, Worf.
Come.
Captain, I request a leave of   absence.
Mister Worf... request granted.
Thank you, sir.
Mister Worf...       Qapla!
And good luck.
Lieutenant Worf, personal log,   stardate 44996.1. I have located   the Klingon ship on which my   brother Kurn serves as captain   and have arranged to join him.
It has been too long, my brother.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: Too long.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: There is much to discuss. I have   asked Gowron to restore our family   honor. He has refused.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: No matter. Gowron will not live   to see the day he leads the   Council...
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: What do you mean?
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: He stands alone, surrounded by   his enemies. Lursa and B-Etor   will have him killed... and if   they don't, I will.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: You will... ?
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: Gowron is weak... and the family   of Duras must never be allowed   to lead the Council. All of our   leaders... have failed us. They   no longer deserve our loyalty.       It is time to sweep away the old   Council... and put a new one in   its place.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: How could this be done?
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: I already have the support of four   squadron commanders in strategic   sectors. When the time comes,   they will follow me.       Join us, Worf... we will usher   in a new era, and regain our   family name.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: No.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: What?
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: Gowron has completed the rite of   succession... it is our duty to   support him.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: Gowron spits in your face when   you ask him to give back what is   rightfully ours... and you would   support him?
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: We cannot regain honor by acting   dishonorably.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: I will not support Gowron.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: I am the elder brother, Kurn...   I speak for our family.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: We will back Gowron.       But not now. Not yet. We will   wait. Until Gowron feels the   grasp of his enemies around his   throat. Then we will offer him   our support. And the price will   be the restoration of our family   name.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: It will be difficult to convince   my allies to back Gowron.       But I will try. I must go to the   Mempa sector and meet with the   other squadron commanders.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: Contact me when you have gained   their support.       Then I will be ready for Gowron.
scene: 14	INT. BIRD OF PREY - READY ROOM

quote: naDev ghoS!
Have you reached a decision   regarding the succession of   power?
Qaja plu d'itch jung. La woq you   ghir klas qimha. Gowron. Doj   hon. Doj hon.
Your Klingon is flawless, Picard.   Not even a trace of a human   accent. The Council thanks you   for your service to the Empire.
Gowron, son of M'Rel, hakt'em.
The arbiter confirms that you   have completed the rite of   succession. Your enemies have   been destroyed. You stand alone.   Do you wish to claim leadership   of the Council?
I wish it.
Are there no other challengers?
There is one.
I will challenge him.
An arrogant child!
Who are you?
I am Toral... son of Duras.
Duras had no son!
But he did...
So, this is your doing...
We wish to address the Council.
Lursa, B'Etor, come forward.
Members of the High Council, it   is a day of great rejoicing for   the family of Duras and the   Klingon Empire. We have   discovered that our brother did   indeed have a son and heir.
This is an outrage! Duras had   no mate. Where did you find him,   Lursa? In a harlot's bed   chamber?
I will personally cut your tongue   out, Yintagh!
Impudent wretch.
A simple genetic scan will prove   his bloodline is valid.
The illegitimate son of Duras   cannot rule the High Council.
The Council will decide whether   to accept the challenge of Toral,   alleged son of Duras. In favor?
Opposed.
The challenge is accepted.
The arbiter will consider its   validity.       Len'mat.
Our allies on the Council backed   Toral's claim. It's in Picard's   hands, now.
Excellent. Everything is   proceeding as scheduled.
It will make matters simpler if   the captain is cooperative... but   we are prepared to move in any   case.
Why not just kill Picard?
Fool! Do we want the Federation   as our enemy?
No.
At least, not yet. But when the   time is right... we will deal with   the Federation... and Captain   Picard.
I have met with the other squadron   commanders here... three will join   us, one will not.
That gives us enough strength to   control seven key sectors.
Do you know the strength of our   enemies?
They have at least seven   squadrons... but most of the fleet   has not decided which banner to   follow.
Gowron is nearly out of options.   Soon he will have no choice...
I will soon return to the Home   World. We shall meet then.
Do you also require the original   logs recorded during the attack,   Lieutenant?
Everything we have on the   Khitomer massacre.

I can provide you with our   analysis of communications between   the Khitomer outpost and the   Romulan ships; however, for a   complete record you will have to   contact Starbase Twenty-Four and   request---
Mister Worf... have you cancelled   your leave?
No, sir.
Lieutenant... join me in my ready   room.
You are planning to use our files   on the Khitomer massacre as   evidence against Duras' father?
Yes, sir.
Mister Worf... do you not see an   inherent conflict of interest...
Sir, these records can help me   prove that my father was falsely   accused of treason.
You are using your position as   a Starfleet officer to affect   political change on your   planet... there could not be a   worse compromise of our   fundamental principles...
Captain... you urged me to fight   this battle...
Yes, I know. I understand your   motives, and you know I support   your goals, but...
Do not tie my hands now... I   must be able to prove my father's   innocence. The Federation records   will do that.
Mister Worf... Mister Worf...       Mister Worf...

Here I am lecturing you on a   conflict of interest while I'm   desperately trying to avoid one   of my own. Do you think I wish   to allow the Duras family to   solidify their hold on the   Council? Do you think I cannot   see the implications for the   Federation? And good Lord, Duras   tried to have me killed!       All of my instincts... my   training... my very being as a   Starfleet officer are at odds with   my responsibilities as arbiter   for the Klingon High Council.       We walk the same tightrope between   two worlds... you and I. We must   try our very best to keep those   worlds clearly separate... or we   shall certainly fall.
Yes, sir.
As far as these records from   Khitomer are concerned...
I will make the Federation   records on the Khitomer massacre   available... to anyone who wants   them... the High Council, the   Duras family... anyone.
Thank you, sir.
Mister Worf, this is as far as   I can go.
Riker to Captain Picard.
Yes, Number One.
There's a message coming in for   you from the surface. It's coded   personal.
Send it through.
Welcome, Captain.
Something to drink? Tea... Earl   Grey, perhaps?
Yes... thank you.
You come... alone and unarmed...
Nothing would be served by killing   the arbiter before his decision.
Nevertheless, a brave act,   Captain.
B'Etor...
Your invitation was... unexpected.
We should have extended it much   sooner.
We don't want you to judge us by   your experience with our brother.
Duras was a fool.
He deserved to die.
Forget him. We have.
We do not wish to be your enemy.
Quite the opposite.
That... pleases me.
Have you made a decision regarding   Toral's challenge?
I am pursuing it with all due   vigilance.
Let me heat your tea.
Toral has the bloodline to lead   the Empire into the next century.   He has the support of the people.
The remaining issue then is to   see if he has the support of the   law.
But he must. Surely, you can see   that.

I'll tell you what I see. If I   find Toral's challenge valid, the   two of you will very quickly gain   control of the Council... and   Gowron will be found dead shortly   thereafter. If I reject Toral's   challenge, you will accuse me of   doing it only to serve Federation   interests. It will give you a   rallying cry to declare war and   overthrow Gowron.
You see very clearly, Captain.   But one thing is missing.   If you rule against us and we are   victorious in a war against   Gowron...
... which we would be...
... it would mean the end of the   alliance with the Federation.
And we'd hate to see that happen   as much as you would.
This is not a threat, Captain.   Just an unfortunate truth.
So why be our enemy, when you can   be our friend?
You have manipulated the   circumstances, ladies, with the   skill of a Romulan.       My decision will be announced at   high sun tomorrow. Excellent tea.   Good day.
What is your decision?

K'tal, this Council knows the law   of heredity well. G'now juk Hol   pajhard. A son will share in   the honors or crimes of his   father. Toral is Duras' son...   that has been established by the   genetic scan. And it is   heartwarming to see him embraced   by the family of Duras... for they   are an old and noble family.       But with due respect to the   traditions and laws of this High   Council, there is no basis for   accepting a petition for   leadership from a boy who has   fought no battles, shed no blood   for his people, earned no honor   for himself. Perhaps some day   he shall. But not now.
Duras... is dead. His claim to   the leadership died with him.   Gowron will lead the Council.
The arbiter has ruled. There   are no more challengers.
Does the Federation dictate   Klingon destiny or do we? Follow   me. And I will show you honor.
Follow him and you reject all   Klingon law...
Can you not see what you are   doing... are you blind to what   they represent... are there so   few noble Klingons left?
Then go... your blood will paint   the way to the future.
Remember this day.
Your message said it was urgent.   What do you want?
Your forces are weak, Gowron...   you will need help to fight the   family of Duras.
From one dishonored Klingon...
I offer you four Klingon   squadrons.
Why would they follow you... a   Starfleet officer?
They are pledged to support...   my brother, Kurn.
Kurn is your brother?
His true bloodline was kept   hidden to protect him.
Kurn will follow me? He has   opposed me in the past.
I am the elder brother... he will   do as I say.
What is it you want in return?
You know my price.
The return of your honor. For   the support of four squadrons... ?   No, that will not be enough.   The Duras family controls most   of the fleet.       We must have Federation help.
They will not intervene.
Perhaps not yet... but Starfleet   Command will listen to Picard...   and Picard listens to you.
I can ask nothing more of him in   this matter.
What?
My duty as a Starfleet officer---
You come to me and demand the   restoration of your family   honor... and now you hide behind   Human excuses!

What are you, Worf? Do you   tremble and quake with fear at   the approach of combat... hoping   to talk your way out of a fight...   like a Human... or do you hear   the cry of the warrior... calling   you to battle... calling you to   glory... like a Klingon?       Are you one of us?
Status!
Aft shields down...
Warp coils damaged...
Report.
We're still trying to sort it out.   A Klingon Bird of Prey just   decloaked and fired on the   Bortas. Neither ship is answering   our hail.
Worf is still aboard the Bortas.
A second Bird of Prey is   decloaking bearing two-four-seven   mark three-one-nine.
Go to Red Alert.
The second ship is joining the   attack on the Bortas.
It's begun.
Send an emergency signal to any   loyal ships!
Impulse engines not responding!
Engage emergency override!
Override engaged! Disruptors   still not responding!
The Bortas is sustaining heavy   damage, Captain. Her aft shields   have collapsed... life support   fluctuating...
The Bortas should have twice the   firepower of a Bird of Prey.
Her weapons systems were hit   pretty hard... they haven't   brought them back on-line yet.
The Bortas has lost its port   shields... it is unlikely they   will withstand another hit on that   quarter.
The Bortas has sent out a general   distress signal.
Ensign Reel... plot a course   safely away from the combat area.   Half impulse.
Captain... the Bortas is Gowron's   ship. If he's the legitimate   leader of the Empire, shouldn't   we help him?
If we come to his aid... we'll   be dragging the Federation into   a Klingon civil war.
What about Worf?
Ensign... engage.
The port shields are still down.
Disruptors on-line!
(moving to command     chair)   Lock on target.
No!
Their sensors will detect the   weapons lock. If they think   we're helpless, they'll try to   board the ship.
I can aim and fire disruptors   manually when they drop their   shields.
GhoS!
Thirty-five thousand kellicams.       Twenty thousand kellicams... now   within transporter range.
SuH...
They're dropping shields!
BaH!
Engaging computer control...   firing on second target!
They were able to raise shields   in time... minor damage only.
Disruptors off-line!
All power to shields.
Shields failing!
Incoming message.
On viewer.
This is Captain Kurn of the   Hegh'ta. We come to defend the   Empire... and to follow the banner   of Gowron.
The enemy has sustained major   damage to its life support   systems... They have disengaged.
You have done well, Commander   Kurn. Lursa and B'Etor have   moved more quickly than I   anticipated. We shall not   underestimate them again.       Meet us at the Great Hall.
(continuing, to First     Officer)   Advise the Enterprise that their   delegation is welcome to attend...   my installation as leader.

Gowron, son of M'Rel, hakt'em.   The arbiter confirms that you   have completed the rite of   succession. Your enemies have   been destroyed. You stand alone.   Do you wish to claim leadership   of the Council?
I wish it.
Are there no other challengers?
Receive now the loyalty of the   Council and of the Empire.
Let all who have opposed me now   swear loyalty or die with shame!
Qapla!
naDev ghoS!   All eyes on Worf as he moves to the center of the room. Kurn moves to stand beside him. Gowron steps down from the chair and moves directly in front of them
You both fought as warriors...   you have proved your hearts are   Klingon.
I return your family honor... I   give you back what was wrongfully   taken from you. Let your name   be spoken once again. You are   Worf... son of Mogh.
The Duras family is gathering a   large force near Beta Thoridar.   As per the terms of the Treaty   of Alliance, I now formally   request your assistance in   fighting these enemies of the   Empire.
These... enemies are Klingons.
By right and tradition, I am now   the sole leader... all who oppose   me... are traitors.
I understand your position.   However, you must be aware that   the Federation will not become   involved in what is, by   definition, an internal Klingon   matter.
You arbitrated the rite of   succession, you are already   involved!
And my duties in that regard are   finished.
Captain... we must intervene.

The Duras family is corrupt and   hungry for power... with no sense   of honor or loyalty. They   represent a grave threat to the   security of the Federation.    (beat, then quieter,     a direct appeal)   Captain, you and I know that they   have conspired with Romulans in   the past. If they should be the   victors in this war, they will   surely form a new Klingon/Romulan   alliance. That would represent   a fundamental shift of power in   this quadrant.       Starfleet must support Gowron...   it is in the interests of both   the Federation and the Empire.   I beg you to support us in our   cause.

Mister Worf... non-interference   in the internal affairs of other   cultures is one of the guiding   principles of the Federation...   and as Starfleet officers, we have   all sworn an oath to uphold that   principle regardless of personal   feeling.       I am sorry... but I must refuse   your request.
Lieutenant...
I'm afraid that I must now recall   you to duty. The Enterprise will   be leaving this sector   immediately.
Captain... I respectfully request   that I be allowed to take an   extended leave of absence.
Lieutenant, your responsibilities   as a Starfleet officer are   incompatible with remaining aboard   a Klingon ship during a time of   war.
Captain...
You are ordered to return to duty   immediately.
Then... I must resign my   commission as a Starfleet officer.
I will await you aboard the   Bortas.
Enter.

quote: Am I intruding?
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: No, sir.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: I understand... that you'll be   serving aboard the Bortas.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: As weapons officer.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Your tactical knowledge and   experience should serve them well.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Thank you, sir.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Are you certain you've made the   right decision, Worf?
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Yes.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: I was rescued from Khitomer by   humans... raised and... loved by   human parents. I have lived among   humans for most of my life...   fought at their sides.       But I was born Klingon. My heart   is of that world. I do hear the   cry of the warrior...       I belong with my people.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Being the only Klingon ever to   serve in Starfleet... gave you   a singular distinction.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: But I always felt that the most   unique thing about you was   your... humanity.       Compassion... generosity...   fairness... You took some of the   best qualities of humanity and   made them part of you. The   result... was a man I was proud   to call one of my officers.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: I'll have your belongings   transported to the Bortas.
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Thank you...
scene: 53	INT. WORF'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Attention on deck!
Permission to leave the ship, sir?
Permission granted.       Qapla'
Good-bye.
Dismissed.
Picard has rejected Gowron's plea   for help.       The Enterprise has left orbit.
Coward! He didn't have the   courage to face us. The   Federation is---
Celebrate later, Toral.       We should not discount Jean-Luc   Picard yet. He is human...
(continuing, with ironic     smile)   ... and humans have a way of   showing up when you least expect   them.
